page.title: 18Tourism
page.content: Tourism in the area is a very low-key industry but is the one which offers the biggest potential for future employment and economic growth.A public enquiry later this year will decide whether to designate the North Pennines an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.Ranged against this designation are the local parish councils,the National Farmers Union and the Country Landowners Association .For designation are the proposers the Countryside Commission,the County Council,The Council for the Protection of Rural England, the Nature Conservancy Council, the Ramblers Association and other bodies interested in greater access to the countryside for more people.Tourism would create a demand for services leading to more jobs,more money in the local economy thus greater prosperity.
